Subjective: Spot on neck x2 weeks. Suspected wart, but now unsure. Onset after shaving (small wound). Itches. Insect bite at same location, causing swelling/redness. Negatives: No pain, no similar spots elsewhere. Social: No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Family history: Skin issues on father's side (sun-related). ICE: Concerned about skin cancer after online search.
Objective: Skin lesion: Raised ~0.5cm, pinkish-red, slightly redder center. No crusting/scab seen. Surrounding freckles, but distinct from lesion. Neck: No palpable lymph nodes, no other suspicious spots.
Assessment: Skin lesion of uncertain etiology. Differential includes: Pyogenic granuloma, atypical mole. Ruled out: Typical freckle.
Plan: 1. Teledermatology consult: Send lesion photo to dermatologist for evaluation. 2. Follow-up: Patient will call back on Friday (before 10am or after 3pm) for dermatology recommendations. 3. Possible interventions (pending dermatology advice): Cryotherapy, excision, or curettage with histopathology. 4. Discussed knee pain, advised to schedule separate appointment for evaluation.
